rules.title: Rules to validate IFD Master Image
rules.description: The following rules validate a valid ifd storing a master image according to TI/A specifications

rule.title: Square aspect ration
rule.description: In TI/A the only valid pixel aspect ratio is 1:1 (square), so that XResolution equals YResolution
rule.assert: In TI/A the only valid pixel aspect ratio is 1:1 (square)

rule.title: Strip data Structure
rule.description: The image data is stored using strips, which are collectively termed segments. The following tag-fields define the number of strips and the number of rows of image data stored in each strip: StripOffsets, RowsPerStrip, and StripByteCounts. The image shall be divided into an integral number of strips, from 1 strip to the maximum number of strips, which equals the imageâ€™s length. If necessary, the final strip can be "padded" with zeros.
rule.assert: In TI/A the only data structure supported are strips

rule.title: 64 Kbytes per strip
rule.description: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip. This value is chosen to maximize compatibility with various operating systems.
rule.assert: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip.

rule.title: NewSubFileType defined
rule.description: New NewSubFileType tag must be explicit defined in an Image File Directory storing a master image.
rule.assert: New NewSubFileType tag must be explicitly defined in an Image File Directory storing a master image.

rule.title: Valid NewSubFileType
rule.description: NewSubFileType tag must define a full resolution image in an Image File Directory storing a master image.
rule.assert: NewSubFileType invalid value for a master image, the value should define a full resolution image.

rule.title: valid NewSubFileType
rule.description: TI/A standard TIFF defines a unique valid value for NewSubFileType, the value should be 0 for a full resolution image.
rule.assert: NewSubFileType invalid values, the value should be 0 for a full resolution image

rule.title: SubIFD not permitted
rule.description: TI/A do not permit the use of SubIFDs in a master image.
rule.assert: TI/A do not permit the use of SubIFDs in a master image

rule.title: Master image with a subIFD thumbnail
rule.description: Although TI/A do not recommend the use of thumbnails, when a thumbnails is defined it must contain a subIFD containing the main image.
rule.assert: Invalid IFD structure,The Master image define a subIFD containing a thumbnail

rule.title: Master image recommended compression
rule.description: TI/A do not recommend the use of compression for storing a master images, An uncompressed image is always the best option for archival purpose
rule.assert: TI/A do not recommend the use of compression for storing a master images, an uncompressed image is preferred for archival purpose

rule.title: CCITT 1D compression
rule.description: CCITT 1D compression is not widely used for archival purpose, therefore obsolete
rule.assert: CCITT 1D Compression is forbidden regarding the TI/A the specification

rule.title: Group 3 Fax compression
rule.description: Group 3 Fax compression is not widely used for archival purpose, therefore obsolete
rule.assert: Group 3 Fax Compression is forbidden regarding the TI/A the specification

rule.title: Group 4 Fax compression
rule.description: Although Group 4 Fax compression is supported in TI/A, is not recommended
rule.assert: Group 4 Fax compression is supported in TI/A but not recommended

rule.title: LZW compression
rule.description: LZW compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended
rule.assert: LZW compression is supported in TI/A but not recommended

rule.title: Main image JPEG TIFF/6-.0 compression
rule.description: JPEG 'old' compression is replaced by 'new JPEG' and not widely used for archival purpose, therefore obsoleted
rule.assert: JPEG TIFF/6-.0 'old JPEG' Compression is forbidden regarding the TI/A the specification

rule.title: Main image JPEG TIFF TechNote2 compression
rule.description: JPEG TIFF TechNote2 compression 'new JPEG' is not widely used for archival purpose, therefore obsoleted
rule.assert: TI/A recomend the uncompressed image

rule.title: Adobe Deflate compression
rule.description: Adobe Deflate compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended
rule.assert: Adobe Deflate compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: JBIG bw compression
rule.description: JBIG bw compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended
rule.assert: BIG bw compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: JBIG color compression
rule.description: JBIG color compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended
rule.assert: JBIG color compression is supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: Vendor Unique compressions
rule.description: Vendor Unique compressions (> 32766) are not widely used, therefore obsolete
rule.assert: Vendor Unique compressions (> 32766) are not widely used, therefore obsolete

rule.title: Recommended PhotometricInterpretation
rule.description: TI/A Standard only recommend the use of RGB, Grayscale(BlackIsZero) and Bilevel(BlackIsZero) images.
rule.assert: TI/A Standard only recommend the use of RGB, Grayscale(BlackIsZero) and Bilevel(BlackIsZero) images

rule.title: Palette color images
rule.description: Palette color images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended.
rule.assert: Palette color images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: Transparency Mask
rule.description: Transparency Mask images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended.
rule.assert: Transparency Mask images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: CMYKk images
rule.description: CMYKk images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended
rule.assert: CMYKk images are supported in TI/A specifications but not recommended

rule.title: YCbCr images
rule.description: YCbCr color space. Y refers to the luminance component, Cb and Cr refer to the two chrominance components. The component order shall be Y, Cb, Cr. CMYKk images are forbidden in TI/A specifications.
rule.assert: CMYKk images are forbidden in TI/A specifications

rule.title: CFA images
rule.description: CFA images are forbidden in TI/A specifications
rule.assert: CFA images are forbidden in TI/A specifications

rule.title: Vendor Unique PhotometricInterpretation
rule.description: Vendor Unique PhotometricInterpretation are not required to be interpreted by others. Their values need to be obtained from Adobe Corporation. Vendor Unique PhotometricInterpretation (>32767) are forbidden in TI/A specifications.
rule.assert: Vendor Unique PhotometricInterpretation (>32767) are forbidden in TI/A specifications.

rules.title: Rules to validate IFD Thumbnail
rules.description: This rules section validate a valid thumbnail followin the TI/A specifications

rule.title: Thumbnail square aspect ration
rule.description: In TI/A the only valid pixel aspect ratio is 1:1 (square), so that XResolution equals YResolution
rule.assert: In TI/A the only valid pixel aspect ratio is 1:1 (square)

rule.title: Thumbnail strip data Structure
rule.description: TI/A requires that the thumbnail image be stored in strips, so that the thumbnails may be read by any baseline TIFF 6.0 reader.
rule.assert: In TI/A the only data structure supported are strips

rule.title: Thumbnail 64 Kbytes per strip
rule.description: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip. This value is chosen to maximize compatibility with various operating systems.
rule.assert: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip.

rule.title: Thumbnail No compression
rule.description: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip. This value is chosen to maximize compatibility with various operating systems.
rule.assert: It is recommended that the image data, prior to compression, not exceed 64 Kbytes per strip.

rule.title: Thumbnail NewSubFileType defined
rule.description: NewSubFileType must be defined for TI/A standard TIFF Thumbnail.
rule.assert: NewSubFileType must be defined for TI/A standard TIFF Thumbnail.

rule.title: Thumbnail valid NewSubFileType
rule.description: NewSubFileType must be propertly defined for TI/A standard TIFF Thumbnail.
rule.assert: Thumbnail NewSubFileType must define a thumbnail image

rule.title: Thumbnail valid NewSubFileType
rule.description: NewSubFileType must be propertly defined for TI/A standard TIFF Thumbnail.
rule.assert: TI/A standard only permit NewSubFileType value 1 for thumbnail image

rule.title: Thumbnail ImageWidth
rule.description: The dimensions of the thumbnail image are restricted by TI/A to 256 pixels maximum horizontally and 256 pixels maximum vertically as defined in TIFF/EP.
rule.assert: The dimensions of the thumbnail image are restricted by TI/A to 256 pixels maximum.

rule.title: Thumbnail ImageLength
rule.description: The dimensions of the thumbnail image are restricted by TI/A to 256 pixels maximum horizontally and 256 pixels maximum vertically as defined in TIFF/EP.
rule.assert: The dimensions of the thumbnail image are restricted by TI/A to 256 pixels.

rule.title: Thumbnail requires SubIFD tag
rule.description: Although TI/A do not recommend the use of thumbnails, when a thumbnails is defined it must contain a subIFD containing the main image.
rule.assert: a thumbnail must contain a Sub-ifd containg the main image

rule.title: Thumbnail dimension lower than main image
rule.description: The resolution X of the sub image (full resolution) must be greater than the thumbnail image
rule.assert: Sub-ifd width must be greater than thumbnail IFD

rule.title: Thumbnail dimension lower than main image
rule.description: The resolution Y of the sub image (full resolution) must be greater than the main (thumbnail) image
rule.assert: Sub-ifd height must be greater than thumbnail IFD

rule.title: Thumbnail subIFD contains a full resolution image
rule.description: TI/A Thumbnail must define a subIFD containing a full resolution image
rule.assert: TI/A Thumbnail must define a subIFD containing a full resolution image

rules.title: Mandatory tags for TI/A
rules.description: This section describes the list of mandatory tags in TI/A Draft

rule.title: NewSubFileType mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag indicates whether the given IFD is a thumbnail or main (full-size) image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated. If the current image is the main image, rather than the 'thumbnail' image, a value of 0 shall be encoded in this field
rule.assert: NewSubFileType is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: NewSubFileType valid values
rule.description: This tag indicates whether the given IFD is a thumbnail or main (full-size) image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated. If the current image is the main image, rather than the 'thumbnail' image, a value of 0 shall be encoded in this field
rule.assert: The only valid values for NewSubFileType are 0 (full resolution image) or 1 (Thumbnail)

rule.title: Imagewidth mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of columns in the image, i.e. the number of pixels per line. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The image width may be the shorter or longer dimension of the image, depending upon the orientation of the camera during image capture
rule.assert: Imagewidth is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: ImageLength mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of rows in the image, i.e. the number of lines in the image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The image length may be the shorter or longer dimension of the image, depending upon the orientation of the camera during image capture
rule.assert: ImageLength is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: BitsPerSample mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of bits per component for each pixel. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. This tag provides N values depending upon SamplesPerPixel present.
rule.assert: BitsPerSample is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: Compression mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the compression scheme used to store the image data. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The tag value shall equal "1" for the thumbnail IFD. In the Context of TI/A the default value is 1. For sustainability compression may not be used.
rule.assert: Compression is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: PhotometricInterpretation mandatory tag
rule.description: In TIFF/EP, this tag defines the color space of the image data components, and the order of the components. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be 1, 2, or 6 for the thumbnail IFD. Accepted values are 1 (grayscale) and 2 (rgb full color).
rule.assert: PhotometricInterpretation is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: StripOffsets mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the byte offset(s) with respect to the beginning of the file to each strip of the image data. This mandatory tag-field is the only way for a reader to find the image data. TIFF baseline plus TI/A requires that the size of the image data contained in each strip, prior to compression, not exceed 64 KBytes.
rule.assert: StripOffsets is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: Orientation valid values
rule.description: This tag encodes the orientation of the camera relative to the scene, when the image was captured. Only the value 1 is allowed.
rule.assert: Orientation valid values regarding the TI/A specifications are 1,3,6,8 or 9

rule.title: SamplesPerPixel mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of components or samples stored for each pixel in the image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated.
rule.assert: SamplesPerPixel is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: SamplesPerPixel valid for Bilevel
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of components or samples stored for each pixel in the image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated.
rule.assert: SamplesPerPixel shall be 1 for Bilevel images

rule.title: SamplesPerPixel valid for Grayscale
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of components or samples stored for each pixel in the image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated.
rule.assert: SamplesPerPixel shall be 1 for Grayscale images

rule.title: SamplesPerPixel valid for RGB
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of components or samples stored for each pixel in the image. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value. The value shall be explicitly stated.
rule.assert: SamplesPerPixel shall be 3 for RGB images

rule.title: RowsPerStrip mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of rows per strip within the image. This tag is mandatory.
rule.assert: RowsPerStrip is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: StripByteCounts mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the number of bytes present in each strip after compression has been applied. This tag is mandatory.
rule.assert: StripBYTECount is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: PlanarConfiguration mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag describes how the components (samples) of each pixel are stored. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value.
rule.assert: PlanarConfiguration is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: ResolutionUnit mandatory tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the unit of measurement for the XResolution and Yresolution. This tag is mandatory and there is no default value.
rule.assert: ResolutionUnit is mandatory regarding the TI/A specifications

rules.title: Recommended tags for TI/A
rules.description: This section describes the list of optional but recommended tags in TI/A Draft

rule.title: Orientation recommended tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the orientation of the camera relative to the scene, when the image was captured. Only the value 1 is allowed.
rule.assert: Orientation is recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: ImageDescription recommended tag
rule.description: A string that describes the subject or purpose of the image is recorded as a null-terminated ASCII string. This tag field may be additionally used to provide any other type of information related to the image. This is a mandatory tag, with an allowed value of " " (null character), indicating "unknown".
rule.assert: ImageDescription is recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: XMP recommended tag
rule.description: This tag defines an XML/RDF-based metadata container.
rule.assert: XMP is recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: Copyright recommended tag
rule.description: This tag encodes the copyright notice of the copyright holder. This is a mandatory tag, with an allowed value of " " (null character), indicating "unknown". The complete copyright statement should be listed in this field including any dates and statements of claims. If desired, this tag-field can also list the royalty clearance house.
rule.assert: Copyright is recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: InterColorProfile recommended tag
rule.description: This tag encodes an embedded InterColor device profile relating to the camera color characterization. Refer to the ICC-resources at www.color.org, for further information on the use of this tag. Note that the ICC Profile Format may be revised in the future, and the most recent version of the ICC specification should be used. Therefore it is only declared optional.
rule.assert: InterColorProfile is recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.description: This tag encodes the number of pixels per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction for the main image. This tag specifies the actual FocalPlaneYResolution at the focal plane of the camera. Since this tag relates to raw images and therefore is not recommended.

reference.section: Section 5.1.2 List of not recommended or problematic Tags

rule.assert: FocalPlaneYResolution is not recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: FocalPlaneResolutionUnitnot recommended tag

rule.title: ImageSourceDatanot recommended tag
rule.description: This tag describes the Adobe Photoshop specific image source data tag. This section has the layer and mask information found in a typical layered Photoshop file. Since layered files are not recommended in TI/A this tag is not allowed.

reference.section: Section 5.1.2 List of not recommended or problematic Tags

rule.assert: ImageSourceData is not recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: JPEGTables not recommended tag
rule.description: This tag replaced the TIFF Rev. 6.0 specification in the tags 512, 513, 514, 515, 517, 518, 519, 520 and 521, whose design proved inappropriate. TIFF JPEG compression is allowed, but not recommended.

reference.section: Section 5.1.2 List of not recommended or problematic Tags

rule.assert: JPEGTables is not recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: ExifIFD not recommended tag
rule.description: Exif IFD is a set of tags for recording Exif-specific attribute information. It is pointed to by the offset from the TIFF header (Value Offset) indicated by an Exif private tag value. An Exif IFD has the same structure as that of the IFD specified in TIFF. Ordinarily, however, it does not contain image data as in the case of TIFF. It is not recommended in TI/A.

reference.section: Section 5.1.2 List of not recommended or problematic Tags

rule.assert: ExifIFD is not recommended regarding the TI/A specifications

rule.title: ExifVersion not recommended tag
rule.description: The version of the supported Exif standard. According to exif.org, nonexistence of this field is taken to mean nonconformance to the Exif standard. In the context of TI/A this tag is not applicable.

reference.section: Section 5.1.2 List of not recommended or problematic Tags

rule.assert: ExifVersion is not recommended regarding the TI/A specifications
